00039 /**
00040 * @file listelement.h
00041 * @date 2008/04/28 16:13
00042 * @author Sergio Montenegro, Lutz Dittrich
00043 *
00044 * Copyright 2008 DLR
00045 *
00046 * @brief linked list management (header)
00047 *
00048 */
00049 
00050 #pragma once
00051 
00052 #include <stdint.h>
00053 
00054 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00055 namespace RODOS {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 
00059 /**
00060 * @def ITERATE_LIST(__type,__list)
00061 * @param[in] __type Base type of list nodes.
00062 * @param[in] __list The list.
00063 * a handy macro: for_each_do
00064 */
00065 #define ITERATE_LIST(__type,__list) \
00066                                 for (__type* iter = (__type*)__list; iter!=0;\
00067                                             iter = (__type*)(iter->getNext()))
00068 
00069 
00070 class ListElement;
00071 
00072 /** A list is just the pointer to the first element */
00073 typedef ListElement* List;
00074 
00075 
00076 /**
00077 * @class ListElement
00078 * @brief node of a single linked list
00079 *
00080 * A node of a single linked list.
00081 * @warning Not thread safe,
00082 * only for static elements which will never be deleted, eg. never on stacks
00083 */
00084 class ListElement {
00085 
00086 private:
00087   /** pointer to next element */
00088   ListElement* next;
00089   static int32_t listElementCounter;
00090 
00091 public:
00092 
00093   /** name of the element */
00094   const char* name;
00095   int32_t listElementID; ///< set from listElementCounter
00096   void* owner; ///< free for user, rodos does not use it
00097 
00098   /** Creates an element and adds it to the beginning of the list.
00099   * @param[in,out] list The list the element shall be added to.
00100   * @param[in] name Clear text name.
00101   */
00102   ListElement(List &list, const char* name = "ListElement", void* myOwner = 0);
00103 
00104   /** destructor */
00105   ~ListElement();
00106 
00107   void append(List& list);
00108 
00109   /**  Get next element in list.
00110   *  @return pointer to next element in the list
00111   */
00112   ListElement* getNext() const {
00113         return next;
00114   }
00115 
00116   /**
00117   * Returns the name of the object as string.
00118   * @return pointer to name of the object
00119   */
00120   const char* getName() const {
00121     return name;
00122   }
00123 
00124 };
